comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Jorge Andre of Hamburg, Germany, married Miss Laura Virginia Webb (b 1892), the only daughter of Francis Egerton Webb (b 1867) and Mary Welsh Randolph Webb (b 1868), in New York City, January 1914. Laura Webb was granddaughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edmund D. Randolph, and of General James Watson Webb. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60A1FFC3C5412738... They had two children, Jorge Rudolph Andre (1914-1955), and Alice Alexandra Andre Floyd-Jones (1916-1993). The timing of this photo, taken between those two births, might explain her very weary expression. ;) Her son Jorge Jr. seems to have married the former wife of Daniel E. Sickles (grandson of the General Sickles found elsewhere in the Bain uploads), and lived here: daytoninmanhattan.blogspot.com/2012/03/unique-1930-henry-... Her daughter Alice's tombstone: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=58382018

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks pennylrichardsca for the information about her wedding.  Did she become a countess?  I wasn't able to tell that from the article.

comment.author: 78412940@N08
comment._content:
Ryan - Jorge Andre was not titled.  Every reference I can find to him is Mr. Jorge R Andre.  Perhaps the photographer was confused.

Jorge Andre is listed as an inventor in the 1915 NY state census (?), a banker in the US 1920 census ... he may have been given a job in his father-in-law's bank. In the 1940 census, Virginia is listed as widowed.
